structMember.name: qualityLevelValueOptionI
structMember.description: Specifies the Telecom option for European standard.

structMember.name: qualityLevelValueOptionII
structMember.description: Specifies the Telecom option for United States standard.

structMember.name: qualityLevelValueOptionIII
structMember.description: Specifies the Telecom option for Japanese standard

enum.name: QLFrom
enum.description: Specifies whether the quality level received on the ethernet interface or from the attribute adminQuality is used.

enum.name: NodeGroupRole
enum.description: Role of the Node Group Member.

enumMember.name: NOT_ACTIVATED_AS_NODE_GROUP_MEMBER
enumMember.description: The node is not activated as a Node Group Member.

enumMember.name: ROLE_NOT_DEFINED
enumMember.description: The node is configured as a Node Group Member, and that the role is not defined.

enumMember.name: SYNC_PROVIDER
enumMember.description: The node has the Synchronization Provider role within the Node Group.

enumMember.name: SYNC_RECEIVER
enumMember.description: The node has the Synchronization Receiver role within the Node Group, and it is in contact with the Synchronization Provider in the same Node Group.

enumMember.name: PRC
enumMember.description: Primary Reference Clock. Highest quality level

enumMember.name: SSU_A
enumMember.description: Synchronization Supply Unit class A. Second quality level

enumMember.name: SSU_B
enumMember.description: Synchronization Supply Unit class B. Third quality level

enumMember.name: SEC_EEC
enumMember.description: Synchronous Equipment Clock/ Ethernet Equipment Clock. Fourth quality level

enum.name: ReferenceStatus
enum.description: The status of a synchronization reference.

enumMember.name: PTP_FAULT
enumMember.description: The corresponding BoundaryOrdinaryClock and or PtpBcOcPort is faulty, check the status attribute on these MOs to identify the specific fault.

enumMember.name: GNSS_FAULT
enumMember.description: Detailed fault information is found in attribute timeSyncIOStatus in TimeSyncIO MO.

enum.name: QualityLevelValueOptionII
enum.description: Telecom option for United States standard.

enumMember.name: PRS
enumMember.description: Primary Reference Source. Highest quality level

enumMember.name: STU
enumMember.description: Synchronization Traceability Unknown. Second quality level

enumMember.name: ST2
enumMember.description: STratum 2 clock. Third quality level

enumMember.name: TNC
enumMember.description: Transit Node Clock. Fourth quality level

enumMember.name: ST3E
enumMember.description: STratum 3 Enhanced clock. Fifth quality level

enumMember.name: ST3_EEC2
enumMember.description: STratum 3 clock./ Ethernet Equipment Clock. Sixth quality level

enumMember.name: SMC_EEC1
enumMember.description: SONET Minimum Clock/ Ethernet Equipment Clock. Seventh quality level

enumMember.name: UNK
enumMember.description: The quality level of the synchronization source is unknown. Highest quality level

enumMember.name: SEC_EEC
enumMember.description: Synchronous Equipment Clock/ Ethernet Equipment Clock. Second quality level

enum.name: SelectionProcessMode
enum.description: Specifies if the quality processing is enabled for input and output.

enumMember.name: QL_ENABLED
enumMember.description: Quality processing is enabled for input and output.

enumMember.name: QL_DISABLED
enumMember.description: Quality processing is disabled for input and output.

enum.name: SyncRefType
enum.description: The type of a synchronization reference.

enumMember.name: SYNC_E
enumMember.description: Synchronous ethernet.

enumMember.name: FREQUENCY_PORT
enumMember.description: Frequency synchronization via physical synchronization port.

enumMember.name: TIME_PORT
enumMember.description: TIme synchronization via physical synchronization port.

enumMember.name: PTP_TIME
enumMember.description: TIme synchronization via PTP port.

enumMember.name: PTP_FREQUENCY
enumMember.description: Frequency synchronization via PTP port.

enumMember.name: NTP_FREQUENCY
enumMember.description: Frequency synchronization via NTP port.

enumMember.name: GNSS_RECEIVER
enumMember.description: Time synchronization via GNSS receiver.

enumMember.name: PRC
enumMember.description: Operational quality is PRC in option I.

enumMember.name: PRS
enumMember.description: Operational quality is PRS in option II.

enumMember.name: STU_OR_UNK
enumMember.description: Operational quality is STU in option II or UNK in option III.

enumMember.name: SSU_A_OR_TNC
enumMember.description: Operational quality is SSU-A in option I or TNC in option II.

enumMember.name: SSU_B
enumMember.description: Operational quality is SSU-B in option I.

enumMember.name: ST2
enumMember.description: Operational quality is ST2 in option II.

enumMember.name: ST3E
enumMember.description: Operational quality is ST3E in option II.

enumMember.name: ST3_OR_EEC2
enumMember.description: Operational quality is ST3/EEC2 in option II.

enumMember.name: SEC_OR_EEC
enumMember.description: Operational quality is SEC/EEC in options I or III.

enumMember.name: SMC_OR_EEC1
enumMember.description: Operational quality is SMC/EEC1 in option II.

enumMember.name: PROV
enumMember.description: Operational quality is PROV in Option II. QL PROV is not supported. It is interpreted as invalid.

enumMember.name: DNU_OR_DUS
enumMember.description: Operational quality is DNU/DUS (Do Not Use for Sync) in all options.

enumMember.name: INV
enumMember.description: Operational quality is INV (Invalid) in all options.

enumMember.name: TCU_02
enumMember.description: An Ericsson TCU02 or SIU is detected upstream.

enumMember.name: QL_UNKNOWN
enumMember.description: Quality level cannot be retrieved or is undefined.

enumMember.name: SMC
enumMember.description: Operational quality is SMC in option II.

enum.name: AvailStatus
enum.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value.

enumMember.name: IN_TEST
enumMember.description: The resource is undergoing a test procedure. If the administrative state is locked or shutting down then normal users are precluded from using the resource.

enumMember.name: FAILED
enumMember.description: The resource has an internal fault that prevents it from operating.

enumMember.name: POWER_OFF
enumMember.description: The resource requires power to be applied and is not powered on.

enumMember.name: OFF_LINE
enumMember.description: The resource requires a routine operation to be performed. This routine operation is to place the resource online and make it available for use. The operation may be manual or automatic, or both. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: OFF_DUTY
enumMember.description: The resource has been made inactive by an internal control process.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY
enumMember.description: The resource cannot operate because some other resource on which it depends is unavailable.

enumMember.name: DEGRADED
enumMember.description: The service available from the resource is degraded in some respect.

enumMember.name: NOT_INSTALLED
enumMember.description: The resource represented by the managed object is not present, or is incomplete.

enumMember.name: LOG_FULL
enumMember.description: This indicates a log full condition.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_LOCKED
enumMember.description: The administrative state of a resource that this resource depends on is locked. or the availability status of the other resource is dependency locked.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_FAILED
enumMember.description: The availability status of a resource that this resource depends on is failed or dependency failed.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_SHUTTINGDOWN
enumMember.description: The administrative state of a resource that this resource depends on is shutting down. or the availability status of the other resource is dependency shutting down.

enum.name: AdmState
enum.description: The administrative state of a resource.

enumMember.name: LOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively prohibited from performing services for its users.

enumMember.name: UNLOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively permitted to perform services for its users. This is independent of its inherent operability.

enumMember.name: SHUTTINGDOWN
enumMember.description: Use of the resource is administratively permitted to existing instances of use only. While the system remains in the shutting down state the manager may at any time cause the managed object to revert to the locked state.

enum.name: RadioEquipmentClockState
enum.description: The state of the radio equipment clock.

enum.name: OperState
enum.description: The operational states of a resource.

enumMember.name: DISABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is totally inoperable.

enumMember.name: ENABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is partially or fully operable.

class.name: RadioEquipmentClock
class.description: This MO class models a clock for a radio base station.

attribute.name: radioEquipmentClockId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: currentRadioClockReference
attribute.description: The currently selected reference to the RadioEquipmentClock MO. The attribute is empty if no clock reference is selected.

attribute.name: radioClockPriorityTable
attribute.description: All configured synchronization reference MOs in the order of priority.

attribute.name: radioClockState
attribute.description: The state of the RadioEquipmentClock MO.

attribute.name: selectionProcessMode
attribute.description: Specifies whether quality processing is enabled.

attribute.name: minQualityLevel
attribute.description: Minimum value of the quality level for all three telecom options, that is required for a source to be accepted as an active synchronization reference.
attribute.dependencies: If Synchronization::telecomStandard is changed, minQualityLevel will change to the quality level value defined within the selected telecom standard.

attribute.name: clockOperQuality
attribute.description: The operational quality of the selected synchronization reference.

attribute.name: nodeGroupRole
attribute.description: The role of the node as a Node Group Member.

attribute.name: clockSettledQuality
attribute.description: The settled quality of the Radio Equipment Clock.

class.name: RadioEquipmentClockReference
class.description:
Models a generic synchronization reference for the radio equipment clock. The specific interface or protocol the reference will use, is configured through the attribute encapsulation.
Dependencies: Two or more RadioEquipmentClockReference cannot have the same priority.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='every $radioEquipmentClockReferenceId in @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId satisfies (every $priority in @priority satisfies (count(../RadioEquipmentClockReference[($radioEquipmentClockReferenceId ne @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId) and ($priority eq @priority)]) eq 0))'> <value-of select="."/> Two or more RadioEquipmentClockReference cannot have the same priority </assert> <assert test='every $radioEquipmentClockReferenceId in @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId satisfies (every $encapsulation in @encapsulation satisfies (count(../RadioEquipmentClockReference[contains($encapsulation, "FrequencySyncIO=") and ($radioEquipmentClockReferenceId ne @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId) and ($encapsulation eq @encapsulation)]) eq 0))'> <value-of select="."/> Two or more RadioEquipmentClockReference cannot refer to same FrequencySyncIO in attribute encapsulation </assert> <assert test='every $radioEquipmentClockReferenceId in @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId satisfies (every $encapsulation in @encapsulation satisfies (count(../RadioEquipmentClockReference[contains($encapsulation, "TimeSyncIO=") and ($radioEquipmentClockReferenceId ne @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId) and ($encapsulation eq @encapsulation)]) eq 0))'> <value-of select="."/> Two or more RadioEquipmentClockReference cannot refer to same TimeSyncIO in attribute encapsulation </assert> <assert test='every $radioEquipmentClockReferenceId in @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId satisfies (every $encapsulation in @encapsulation satisfies (count(../RadioEquipmentClockReference[contains($encapsulation, "EthernetPort=") and ($radioEquipmentClockReferenceId ne @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId) and ($encapsulation eq @encapsulation)]) eq 0))'> <value-of select="."/> Two or more RadioEquipmentClockReference cannot refer to same EthernetPort in attribute encapsulation </assert> <assert test='every $radioEquipmentClockReferenceId in @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId satisfies (every $encapsulation in @encapsulation satisfies (count(../RadioEquipmentClockReference[contains($encapsulation, "BoundaryOrdinaryClock=") and ($radioEquipmentClockReferenceId ne @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId) and ($encapsulation eq @encapsulation)]) eq 0))'> <value-of select="."/> Two or more RadioEquipmentClockReference cannot refer to same BoundaryOrdinaryClock in attribute encapsulation </assert> <assert test='every $radioEquipmentClockReferenceId in @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId satisfies (every $encapsulation in @encapsulation satisfies (count(../RadioEquipmentClockReference[contains($encapsulation, "NtpFrequencySync=") and ($radioEquipmentClockReferenceId ne @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId) and ($encapsulation eq @encapsulation)]) eq 0))'> <value-of select="."/> Two or more RadioEquipmentClockReference cannot refer to same NtpFrequencySync in attribute encapsulation </assert> <assert test='every $encapsulation in @encapsulation satisfies contains(@encapsulation, "TimeSyncIO=") or contains(@encapsulation, "FrequencySyncIO=") or contains(@encapsulation, "EthernetPort=") or (contains(@encapsulation, "BoundaryOrdinaryClock=") and ($encapsulation/@clockType eq 2)) or contains(@encapsulation, "NtpFrequencySync=")'><value-of select="."/> Attribute encapsulation of a RadioEquipmentClockReference can only refer to a FrequencySyncIO, TimeSyncIO, EthernetPort, NtpFrequencySync or BoundaryOrdinaryClock with clockType SLAVE_ONLY_ORDINARY_CLOCK.</assert> <assert test='exists(@encapsulation)'> <value-of select="."/> MO in attribute encapsulation does not exist. </assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='every $radioEquipmentClockReferenceId in @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId satisfies (every $priority in @priority satisfies (count(../RadioEquipmentClockReference[($radioEquipmentClockReferenceId ne @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId) and ($priority eq @priority)]) eq 0))'> <value-of select="."/> Two or more RadioEquipmentClockReference cannot have the same priority </assert> <assert test='every $radioEquipmentClockReferenceId in @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId satisfies (every $encapsulation in @encapsulation satisfies (count(../RadioEquipmentClockReference[contains($encapsulation, "FrequencySyncIO=") and ($radioEquipmentClockReferenceId ne @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId) and ($encapsulation eq @encapsulation)]) eq 0))'> <value-of select="."/> Two or more RadioEquipmentClockReference cannot refer to same FrequencySyncIO in attribute encapsulation </assert> <assert test='every $radioEquipmentClockReferenceId in @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId satisfies (every $encapsulation in @encapsulation satisfies (count(../RadioEquipmentClockReference[contains($encapsulation, "TimeSyncIO=") and ($radioEquipmentClockReferenceId ne @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId) and ($encapsulation eq @encapsulation)]) eq 0))'> <value-of select="."/> Two or more RadioEquipmentClockReference cannot refer to same TimeSyncIO in attribute encapsulation </assert> <assert test='every $radioEquipmentClockReferenceId in @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId satisfies (every $encapsulation in @encapsulation satisfies (count(../RadioEquipmentClockReference[contains($encapsulation, "EthernetPort=") and ($radioEquipmentClockReferenceId ne @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId) and ($encapsulation eq @encapsulation)]) eq 0))'> <value-of select="."/> Two or more RadioEquipmentClockReference cannot refer to same EthernetPort in attribute encapsulation </assert> <assert test='every $radioEquipmentClockReferenceId in @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId satisfies (every $encapsulation in @encapsulation satisfies (count(../RadioEquipmentClockReference[contains($encapsulation, "BoundaryOrdinaryClock=") and ($radioEquipmentClockReferenceId ne @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId) and ($encapsulation eq @encapsulation)]) eq 0))'> <value-of select="."/> Two or more RadioEquipmentClockReference cannot refer to same BoundaryOrdinaryClock in attribute encapsulation </assert> <assert test='every $radioEquipmentClockReferenceId in @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId satisfies (every $encapsulation in @encapsulation satisfies (count(../RadioEquipmentClockReference[contains($encapsulation, "NtpFrequencySync=") and ($radioEquipmentClockReferenceId ne @radioEquipmentClockReferenceId) and ($encapsulation eq @encapsulation)]) eq 0))'> <value-of select="."/> Two or more RadioEquipmentClockReference cannot refer to same NtpFrequencySync in attribute encapsulation </assert> <assert test='every $encapsulation in @encapsulation satisfies contains(@encapsulation, "TimeSyncIO=") or contains(@encapsulation, "FrequencySyncIO=") or contains(@encapsulation, "EthernetPort=") or (contains(@encapsulation, "BoundaryOrdinaryClock=") and ($encapsulation/@clockType eq 2)) or contains(@encapsulation, "NtpFrequencySync=")'><value-of select="."/> Attribute encapsulation of a RadioEquipmentClockReference can only refer to a FrequencySyncIO, TimeSyncIO, EthernetPort, NtpFrequencySync or BoundaryOrdinaryClock with clockType SLAVE_ONLY_ORDINARY_CLOCK.</assert> <assert test='exists(@encapsulation)'> <value-of select="."/> MO in attribute encapsulation does not exist. </assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: radioEquipmentClockReferenceId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: holdOffTime
attribute.description: Specifies the time from fault detection to switch of reference.

attribute.name: useQLFrom
attribute.description: Specifies whether the quality level received from network or from the attribute adminQuality is used.

attribute.name: syncRefType
attribute.description: Indicates the type of synchronization reference.

attribute.name: waitToRestoreTime
attribute.description: Specifies time from fault cease to switch back to a reference with higher priority.

attribute.name: priority
attribute.description: Specifies the priority of the synchronization reference.
attribute.dependencies: Two or more RadioEquipmentClockReference cannot have the same priority.

attribute.name: operQualityLevel
attribute.description:
Indicates the quality level used by the process for the synchronization reference selection.
If useQLFrom is set to RECEIVED_QL, the quality level extracted from the underlying reference is indicated. If useQLFrom is set to ADMIN_QL, the quality level specified by the attribute adminQualityLevel is indicated.

attribute.name: adminQualityLevel
attribute.description: Specifies the quality level value to override the received quality level, if useQLFrom is set to ADMIN_QL for all three telecom options.
attribute.dependencies: If the attribute telecomStandard in the MO class Synchronization is changed, adminQualityLevel will change to the quality level value defined within the selected telecom standard.

attribute.name: encapsulation
attribute.description:
Reference to the underlying encapsulation.
The underlying encapsulation can be FrequencySyncIO, TimeSyncIO, EthernetPort, BoundaryOrdinaryClock or NtpFrequencySync MO.
attribute.dependencies: Two or more RadioEquipmentClockReference cannot refer to same FrequencySyncIO. Two or more RadioEquipmentClockReference cannot refer to same TimeSyncIO. Two or more RadioEquipmentClockReference cannot refer to same EthernetPort. Two or more RadioEquipmentClockReference cannot refer to same BoundaryOrdinaryClock. Two or more RadioEquipmentClockReference cannot refer to same NtpFrequencySync. Attribute encapsulation of a RadioEquipmentClockReference can only refer to a FrequencySyncIO, TimeSyncIO, EthernetPort, BoundaryOrdinaryClock or NtpFrequencySync with clockType SLAVE_ONLY_ORDINARY_CLOCK.

attribute.name: referenceStatus
attribute.description: The status of a synchronization reference.

attribute.name: receivedQualityLevel
attribute.description: Indicates the received quality level for the underlying reference. Note that some types of references lack quality level information.
